experience: Allen Thomas can introduce you to 2 people at Green School
Allen Thomas worked at Green School
Once again on the market seeking full-time employment anywhere in the world! Any leads would be much appreciated. Fondly, Allen.

Designed and created an 11 look capsule collection to initially launch his brainchild fashion and wellbeing company. As an entrepreneur he sees and does everything that needs to happen for the company to work. He is preparing to take orders, and produce the collection before end of year.

Designed textile patterns for handbags and pillows for internationally reknowned social enterprise and fashion house focusing on handwoven bags. Spearheaded designing the social enterprises’ first clothing line.

Assisted in design research and clarifying brand communication at nascent brand devoted to gently disrupting the fashion industry through materials and retail experience technology for an excitingly sustainable future.
Helped polish the collection and dress models for the Teatum-Jones London Fashion Week A/W 2017 show.
Teatum Jones Autumn/Winter 2017 Ready to Wear Collection | British Vogue
Teatum Jones Autumn/Winter 2017 Ready to Wear Collection | British Vogue

A theory and practise based degree. Researched and developed projects throughout the course proposing how fashion by design can engage individuals in their environments for the sake of sustainability. His master’s project aims to design a fashion experience that facilitates an understanding of the cult, interconnected relationship between textiles and nature as shared by animistic Indonesian cultures, to rediscover invisible structures of sustainability.

Cornell University - College of Architecture, Art, and Planning
Urban Studies, International Relations, and Law minors.

A liberal arts and researched based design degree. Completed various units from environmental economics to Poetry and Mind. Submitted fashion related research such as the effect of Chinese migration on Italy’s Prato textile industry, cultural regeneration in London’s Shoreditch and Rome’s Corviale, and the global influence of fashion on humans and our planet. Graduated as a Davis United World Scholar.

summary: Situationist Fashion Futures designer, artist, activist, and entrepreneur. Started first company at sixteen. Envisions fashion and other spaces as tools to reawaken the imperative of sustainability. My work aims to help earthlings better understand and situate themselves in their bodies and Earth's systems for sustainable well being. Born in San Francisco, lived in the U.S.A., Italy, the Philippines, Indonesia, and Singapore. Passionate about responsible sourcing and design on all levels. He firmly believes that Fashion, true to its etymological roots, is about making and creation itself. He firmly believes that the Fashion Industry is one of the top three most well positioned industries to drive systems that alleviate world poverty on all relational levels. The time is more ripe now than ever for Fashion to spread environmental health, wealth, and personal well-being.
name: Allen Thomas Litton Navasero
title: Bodies as Clothing. To once again become a thing that feels.
